name: artifactory
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing artifactory cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`artifactory` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/jfrog/terraform-provider-artifactory).

accessToken.description: This is a bearer token that can be given to you by your admin under `Identity and Access`

apiKey.deprecationMessage: Xray and projects functionality will not work with any auth method other than access tokens (Bearer)

password.description:
Insider note: You may actually use an api_key as the password. This will get your around xray limitations instead of a
bearer token
password.deprecationMessage: Xray and projects functionality will not work with any auth method other than access tokens (Bearer)

username.deprecationMessage: Xray and projects functionality will not work with any auth method other than access tokens (Bearer)

apiUrl.description: OAuth user info endpoint for the IdP.

authUrl.description: OAuth authorization endpoint for the IdP.

clientId.description: OAuth client ID configured on the IdP.

clientSecret.description: OAuth client secret configured on the IdP.

enabled.description: Enable the Artifactory OAuth provider.  Default value is `true`.

name.description: Name of the Artifactory OAuth provider.

tokenUrl.description: OAuth token endpoint for the IdP.

repositories.description: List of repositories this permission target is applicable for

users.description: Users this permission target applies for.

repositories.description: List of repositories this permission target is applicable for

users.description: Users this permission target applies for.

repositories.description: List of repositories this permission target is applicable for

users.description: Users this permission target applies for.

password.description: Requires password encryption to be turned off `POST /api/system/decrypt`

actions.description: (Required) Nested block describing the actions to be applied by the policy. Described below.

criteria.description: (Required) Nested block describing the criteria for the policy. Described below.

blockDownload.description: (Optional) Nested block describing artifacts that should be blocked for download if a violation is triggered. Described below.

customSeverity.description: (Optional) The severity of violation to be triggered if the `criteria` are met.

failBuild.description: (Optional) Whether or not the related CI build should be marked as failed if a violation is triggered. This option is only available when the policy is applied to an `xray_watch` resource with a `type` of `builds`.

mails.description: (Optional) A list of email addressed that will get emailed when a violation is triggered.

webhooks.description: (Optional) A list of Xray-configured webhook URLs to be invoked if a violation is triggered.

active.description: Whether or not to block download of artifacts that meet the artifact and severity `filters` for the associated `xray_watch` resource.

unscanned.description: Whether or not to block download of artifacts that meet the artifact `filters` for the associated `xray_watch` resource but have not been scanned yet.

allowUnknown.description: (Optional) Whether or not to allow components whose license cannot be determined (`true` or `false`).

allowedLicenses.description: (Optional) A list of OSS license names that may be attached to a component.

bannedLicenses.description: (Optional) A list of OSS license names that may not be attached to a component.

cvssRange.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a CVS score range to be impacted. Defined below.

minSeverity.description: (Optional) The minimum security vulnerability severity that will be impacted by the policy.

from.description: (Required) The beginning of the range of CVS scores (from 1-10) to flag.

to.description: (Required) The end of the range of CVS scores (from 1-10) to flag.

name.description: The name of the policy that will be applied

binMgrId.description: The ID number of a binary manager resource

filters.description: Nested argument describing filters to be applied. Defined below.

repoType.description: Type of repository (e.g. local or remote)

type.description: Type of resource to be watched
The type of filter, such as `regex` or `package-type`

value.description: The value of the filter, such as the text of the regex or name of the package type

provider.description:
The provider type for the artifactory package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

password.description:

bearer token

artifactory:index/accessToken:AccessToke.description:
## Import

Artifactory **does not** retain access tokens and cannot be imported into state.

accessToken.description: Returns the access token to authenciate to Artifactory

adminToken.description: (Optional) Specify the `instance_id` in this block to grant this token admin privileges. This can only be created when the authenticated user is an admin. `admin_token` cannot be specified with `groups`.

audience.description: (Optional) A space-separate list of the other Artifactory instances or services that should accept this token identified by their Artifactory Service IDs. You may set `"jfrt@*"` so the token to be accepted by all Artifactory instances.

endDate.description: (Optional) The end date which the token is valid until, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`).

endDateRelative.description: (Optional) A relative duration for which the token is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Valid time units are "s", "m", "h".

groups.description: (Optional) List of groups. The token is granted access based on the permissions of the groups. Specify `["*"]` for all groups that the user belongs to. `groups` cannot be specified with `admin_token`.

refreshToken.description: Returns the refresh token when `refreshable` is true, or an empty string when `refreshable` is false

refreshable.description: (Optional) Is this token refreshable? Defaults to `false`

username.description: (Required) The username or subject for the token. A non-admin can only specify their own username. Admins can specify any existing username, or a new name for a temporary token. Temporary tokens require `groups` to be set.

adminToken.description: (Optional) Specify the `instance_id` in this block to grant this token admin privileges. This can only be created when the authenticated user is an admin. `admin_token` cannot be specified with `groups`.

audience.description: (Optional) A space-separate list of the other Artifactory instances or services that should accept this token identified by their Artifactory Service IDs. You may set `"jfrt@*"` so the token to be accepted by all Artifactory instances.

endDate.description: (Optional) The end date which the token is valid until, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`).

endDateRelative.description: (Optional) A relative duration for which the token is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Valid time units are "s", "m", "h".

groups.description: (Optional) List of groups. The token is granted access based on the permissions of the groups. Specify `["*"]` for all groups that the user belongs to. `groups` cannot be specified with `admin_token`.

refreshable.description: (Optional) Is this token refreshable? Defaults to `false`

username.description: (Required) The username or subject for the token. A non-admin can only specify their own username. Admins can specify any existing username, or a new name for a temporary token. Temporary tokens require `groups` to be set.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AccessToken resources.

archiveBrowsingEnabled.description:
When set, you may view content such as HTML or Javadoc files directly from Artifactory. This may not be safe and
therefore requires strict content moderation to prevent malicious users from uploading content that may compromise
security (e.g., cross-site scripting attacks).

key.description: - the identity key of the repo

primaryKeypairRef.description: - The RSA key to be used to sign alpine indecies

artifactory:index/apiKey:ApiKey.description:
## Import

A user's API key can be imported using any identifier, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/apiKey:ApiKey test import
```

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ApiKey resources.

content.description: PEM-encoded client certificate and private key.

issuedBy.description: Name of the certificate authority that issued the certificate.

issuedOn.description: The time & date when the certificate is valid from.

issuedTo.description: Name of whom the certificate has been issued to.

validUntil.description: The time & date when the certificate expires.

content.description: PEM-encoded client certificate and private key.

therefore requires strict content moderation to prevent malicious users from uploading content that may compromise

blockPushingSchema1.description: When set, Artifactory will block the pushing of Docker images with manifest v2 schema 1 to this repository.

key.description: - the identity key of the repo

maxUniqueTags.description:
The maximum number of unique tags of a single Docker image to store in this repository. Once the number tags for an
image exceeds this setting, older tags are removed. A value of 0 (default) indicates there is no limit. This only
applies to manifest v2

tagRetention.description:
If greater than 1, overwritten tags will be saved by their digest, up to the set up number. This only applies to
manifest V2

therefore requires strict content moderation to prevent malicious users from uploading content that may compromise
security (e.g., cross-site scripting attacks).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering GeneralSecurity resources.

excludesPattern.description:
List of artifact patterns to exclude when evaluating artifact requests, in the form of x/y/**/z/*.By default no
artifacts are excluded.

externalDependenciesEnabled.description: . Shorthand for "Enable 'go-import' Meta Tags" on the UI. This must be set to true in order to use the allow list

includesPattern.description:
List of artifact patterns to include when evaluating artifact requests in the form of x/y/**/z/*. When used, only
artifacts matching one of the include patterns are served. By default, all artifacts are included (**/*).

artifactory:index/group:Group.description:
## Import

Groups can be imported using their name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/group:Group terraform-group mygroup
```

adminPrivileges.description: Any users added to this group will automatically be assigned with admin privileges in the system.

autoJoin.description: When this parameter is set, any new users defined in the system are automatically assigned to this group.

detachAllUsers.description: When this override is set, an empty or missing usernames array will detach all users from the group

realmAttributes.description: The realm attributes for the group.

usersNames.description: List of users assigned to the group. If missing or empty, tf will not manage group membership

adminPrivileges.description: Any users added to this group will automatically be assigned with admin privileges in the system.

autoJoin.description: When this parameter is set, any new users defined in the system are automatically assigned to this group.

detachAllUsers.description: When this override is set, an empty or missing usernames array will detach all users from the group

realmAttributes.description: The realm attributes for the group.

usersNames.description: List of users assigned to the group. If missing or empty, tf will not manage group membership

usersNames.description: List of users assigned to the group. If missing or empty, tf will not manage group membership

pairName.description: name of the key pair and the identity of the resource.

pairType.description: RT requires this - presumably for verification purposes.

passphrase.description: - This will be used to decrypt the private key. Validated server side.

privateKey.description: - duh! This will have it's pem format validated

publicKey.description: - duh! This will have it's pem format validated

unavailable.description: - it's unknown what this does, but, it's returned in the payload and there is no known place to set it in the UI

List of artifact patterns to exclude when evaluating artifact requests, in the form of x/y/**/z/*.By default no
artifacts are excluded.

forceMavenAuthentication.description: - forces authentication when fetching from remote repos

includesPattern.description:
List of artifact patterns to include when evaluating artifact requests in the form of x/y/**/z/*. When used, only
artifacts matching one of the include patterns are served. By default, all artifacts are included (**/*).

keyPair.description: - Key pair to use for... well, I'm not sure. Maybe ssh auth to remote repo?

allowUserToAccessProfile.description: Allow persisted users to access their profile.  Default value is `false`.

enable.description: Enable OAuth SSO.  Default value is `true`.

oauthProviders.description: OAuth provider settings block. Multiple blocks can be defined, at least one is required.

persistUsers.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

allowUserToAccessProfile.description: Allow persisted users to access their profile.  Default value is `false`.

enable.description: Enable OAuth SSO.  Default value is `true`.

oauthProviders.description: OAuth provider settings block. Multiple blocks can be defined, at least one is required.

persistUsers.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering OauthSettings resources.

allowUserToAccessProfile.description: Allow persisted users to access their profile.  Default value is `false`.

enable.description: Enable OAuth SSO.  Default value is `true`.

oauthProviders.description: OAuth provider settings block. Multiple blocks can be defined, at least one is required.

persistUsers.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

build.description: As for repo but for artifactory-build-info permssions.
As for repo but for artifactory-build-info permssions.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PermissionTarget resources.

build.description: As for repo but for artifactory-build-info permssions.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PermissionTargets resources.

allowAnyHostAuth.description:
Also known as 'Lenient Host Authentication', Allow credentials of this repository to be used on requests redirected to
any other host.

anonymousAccess.description: - Cargo client does not send credentials when performing download and search for crates. Enable this to allow anonymous access to these resources (only), note that this will override the security anonymous access option.

blackedOut.description:
(A.K.A 'Ignore Repository' on the UI) When set, the repository or its local cache do not participate in artifact
resolution.

blockMismatchingMimeTypes.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

bypassHeadRequests.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

enableCookieManagement.description: Enables cookie management if the remote repository uses cookies to manage client state.

failedRetrievalCachePeriodSecs.deprecationMessage: This field is not returned in a get payload but is offered on the UI. It's inserted here for inclusive and informational reasons. It does not function

gitRegistryUrl.description: - This is the index url, expected to be a git repository. for remote artifactory use "arturl/git/repokey.git"

key.description: The repository identifier. Must be unique system-wide

missedCachePeriodSeconds.description: This is actually the missedRetrievalCachePeriodSecs in the API

offline.description: If set, Artifactory does not try to fetch remote artifacts. Only locally-cached artifacts are retrieved.

retrievalCachePeriodSeconds.description: The metadataRetrievalTimeoutSecs field not allowed to be bigger then retrievalCachePeriodSecs field.

storeArtifactsLocally.description:
When set, the repository should store cached artifacts locally. When not set, artifacts are not stored locally, and
direct repository-to-client streaming is used. This can be useful for multi-server setups over a high-speed LAN, with
one Artifactory caching certain data on central storage, and streaming it directly to satellite pass-though Artifactory
servers.

synchronizeProperties.description: When set, remote artifacts are fetched along with their properties.

allowAnyHostAuth.description:
Also known as 'Lenient Host Authentication', Allow credentials of this repository to be used on requests redirected to
any other host.

anonymousAccess.description: - Cargo client does not send credentials when performing download and search for crates. Enable this to allow anonymous access to these resources (only), note that this will override the security anonymous access option.

blackedOut.description:
(A.K.A 'Ignore Repository' on the UI) When set, the repository or its local cache do not participate in artifact
resolution.

blockMismatchingMimeTypes.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

bypassHeadRequests.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

enableCookieManagement.description: Enables cookie management if the remote repository uses cookies to manage client state.

failedRetrievalCachePeriodSecs.deprecationMessage: This field is not returned in a get payload but is offered on the UI. It's inserted here for inclusive and informational reasons. It does not function

gitRegistryUrl.description: - This is the index url, expected to be a git repository. for remote artifactory use "arturl/git/repokey.git"

key.description: The repository identifier. Must be unique system-wide

missedCachePeriodSeconds.description: This is actually the missedRetrievalCachePeriodSecs in the API

offline.description: If set, Artifactory does not try to fetch remote artifacts. Only locally-cached artifacts are retrieved.

retrievalCachePeriodSeconds.description: The metadataRetrievalTimeoutSecs field not allowed to be bigger then retrievalCachePeriodSecs field.

storeArtifactsLocally.description:
When set, the repository should store cached artifacts locally. When not set, artifacts are not stored locally, and
direct repository-to-client streaming is used. This can be useful for multi-server setups over a high-speed LAN, with
one Artifactory caching certain data on central storage, and streaming it directly to satellite pass-though Artifactory
servers.

synchronizeProperties.description: When set, remote artifacts are fetched along with their properties.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RemoteCargoRepository resources.

allowAnyHostAuth.description:
Also known as 'Lenient Host Authentication', Allow credentials of this repository to be used on requests redirected to
any other host.

anonymousAccess.description: - Cargo client does not send credentials when performing download and search for crates. Enable this to allow anonymous access to these resources (only), note that this will override the security anonymous access option.

blackedOut.description:
(A.K.A 'Ignore Repository' on the UI) When set, the repository or its local cache do not participate in artifact
resolution.

blockMismatchingMimeTypes.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

blockPushingSchema1.description:
When set, Artifactory will block the pulling of Docker images with manifest v2
schema 1 from the remote repository (i.e. the upstream). It will be possible to pull images with manifest v2 schema 1
that exist in the cache.

bypassHeadRequests.description:
Before caching an artifact, Artifactory first sends a HEAD request to the remote resource. In some remote resources,
HEAD requests are disallowed and therefore rejected, even though downloading the artifact is allowed. When checked,
Artifactory will bypass the HEAD request and cache the artifact directly using a GET request.

artifactory:index/remoteRepository:Remot.description:
## Import

Remote repositories can be imported using their name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/remoteRepository:RemoteRepository my-remote my-remote
```

password.description: Requires password encryption to be turned off `POST /api/system/decrypt`

retrievalCachePeriodSeconds.description: The metadataRetrievalTimeoutSecs field not allowed to be bigger then retrievalCachePeriodSecs field.

artifactory:index/replicationConfig:Repl.description:
## Import

Replication configs can be imported using their repo key, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/replicationConfig:ReplicationConfig foo-rep provider_test_source
```

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ReplicationConfig resources.

artifactory:index/samlSettings:SamlSetti.description:
## # Artifactory SAML SSO Settings Resource

This resource can be used to manage Artifactory's SAML SSO settings.

Only a single `artifactory.SamlSettings` resource is meant to be defined.

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as artifactory from "@pulumi/artifactory";

// Configure Artifactory SAML SSO settings
const saml = new artifactory.SamlSettings("saml", {
    allowUserToAccessProfile: true,
    autoRedirect: true,
    certificate: "test-certificate",
    emailAttribute: "email",
    enable: true,
    groupAttribute: "groups",
    loginUrl: "test-login-url",
    logoutUrl: "test-logout-url",
    noAutoUserCreation: false,
    serviceProviderName: "okta",
    syncGroups: true,
    verifyAudienceRestriction: true,
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_artifactory as artifactory

# Configure Artifactory SAML SSO settings
saml = artifactory.SamlSettings("saml",
    allow_user_to_access_profile=True,
    auto_redirect=True,
    certificate="test-certificate",
    email_attribute="email",
    enable=True,
    group_attribute="groups",
    login_url="test-login-url",
    logout_url="test-logout-url",
    no_auto_user_creation=False,
    service_provider_name="okta",
    sync_groups=True,
    verify_audience_restriction=True)
```
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Artifactory = Pulumi.Artifactory;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        // Configure Artifactory SAML SSO settings
        var saml = new Artifactory.SamlSettings("saml", new Artifactory.SamlSettingsArgs
        {
            AllowUserToAccessProfile = true,
            AutoRedirect = true,
            Certificate = "test-certificate",
            EmailAttribute = "email",
            Enable = true,
            GroupAttribute = "groups",
            LoginUrl = "test-login-url",
            LogoutUrl = "test-logout-url",
            NoAutoUserCreation = false,
            ServiceProviderName = "okta",
            SyncGroups = true,
            VerifyAudienceRestriction = true,
        });
    }

}
```
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-artifactory/sdk/go/artifactory"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := artifactory.NewSamlSettings(ctx, "saml", &artifactory.SamlSettingsArgs{
			AllowUserToAccessProfile:  pulumi.Bool(true),
			AutoRedirect:              pulumi.Bool(true),
			Certificate:               pulumi.String("test-certificate"),
			EmailAttribute:            pulumi.String("email"),
			Enable:                    pulumi.Bool(true),
			GroupAttribute:            pulumi.String("groups"),
			LoginUrl:                  pulumi.String("test-login-url"),
			LogoutUrl:                 pulumi.String("test-logout-url"),
			NoAutoUserCreation:        pulumi.Bool(false),
			ServiceProviderName:       pulumi.String("okta"),
			SyncGroups:                pulumi.Bool(true),
			VerifyAudienceRestriction: pulumi.Bool(true),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```
{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

## Import

Current SAML SSO settings can be imported using `saml_settings` as the `ID`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/samlSettings:SamlSettings saml saml_settings
```

allowUserToAccessProfile.description: Allow persisted users to access their profile.  Default value is `true`.

autoRedirect.description: Auto redirect to login through the IdP when clicking on Artifactory's login link.  Default value is `false`.

certificate.description: SAML certificate that contains the public key for the IdP service provider.  Used by Artifactory to verify sign-in requests.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's email.

enable.description: Enable SAML SSO.  Default value is `true`.

groupAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's group memberships.

loginUrl.description: Service provider login url configured on the IdP.

logoutUrl.description: Service provider logout url, or where to redirect after user logs out.

noAutoUserCreation.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

serviceProviderName.description: Name of the service provider configured on the .

syncGroups.description: Associate user with Artifactory groups based on the `group_attribute` provided in the SAML response from the identity provider.  Default value is `false`.

verifyAudienceRestriction.description: Enable "audience", or who the SAML assertion is intended for.  Ensures that the correct service provider intended for Artifactory is used on the IdP.  Default value is `true`.

allowUserToAccessProfile.description: Allow persisted users to access their profile.  Default value is `true`.

autoRedirect.description: Auto redirect to login through the IdP when clicking on Artifactory's login link.  Default value is `false`.

certificate.description: SAML certificate that contains the public key for the IdP service provider.  Used by Artifactory to verify sign-in requests.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's email.

enable.description: Enable SAML SSO.  Default value is `true`.

groupAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's group memberships.

loginUrl.description: Service provider login url configured on the IdP.

logoutUrl.description: Service provider logout url, or where to redirect after user logs out.

noAutoUserCreation.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

serviceProviderName.description: Name of the service provider configured on the .

syncGroups.description: Associate user with Artifactory groups based on the `group_attribute` provided in the SAML response from the identity provider.  Default value is `false`.

verifyAudienceRestriction.description: Enable "audience", or who the SAML assertion is intended for.  Ensures that the correct service provider intended for Artifactory is used on the IdP.  Default value is `true`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering SamlSettings resources.

autoRedirect.description: Auto redirect to login through the IdP when clicking on Artifactory's login link.  Default value is `false`.

certificate.description: SAML certificate that contains the public key for the IdP service provider.  Used by Artifactory to verify sign-in requests.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's email.

enable.description: Enable SAML SSO.  Default value is `true`.

groupAttribute.description: Name of the attribute in the SAML response from the IdP that contains the user's group memberships.

loginUrl.description: Service provider login url configured on the IdP.

logoutUrl.description: Service provider logout url, or where to redirect after user logs out.

noAutoUserCreation.description: Enable the creation of local Artifactory users.  Default value is `false`.

serviceProviderName.description: Name of the service provider configured on the .

syncGroups.description: Associate user with Artifactory groups based on the `group_attribute` provided in the SAML response from the identity provider.  Default value is `false`.

verifyAudienceRestriction.description: Enable "audience", or who the SAML assertion is intended for.  Ensures that the correct service provider intended for Artifactory is used on the IdP.  Default value is `true`.

artifactory:index/user:User.description:
## Import

Users can be imported using their name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/user:User test-user myusername
```

disableUiAccess.description: When set, this user can only access Artifactory through the REST API. This option cannot be set if the user has Admin privileges.

groups.description: List of groups this user is a part of

internalPasswordDisabled.description: When set, disables the fallback of using an internal password when external authentication (such as LDAP) is enabled.

profileUpdatable.description: When set, this user can update his profile details (except for the password. Only an administrator can update the password).

disableUiAccess.description: When set, this user can only access Artifactory through the REST API. This option cannot be set if the user has Admin privileges.

groups.description: List of groups this user is a part of

internalPasswordDisabled.description: When set, disables the fallback of using an internal password when external authentication (such as LDAP) is enabled.

profileUpdatable.description: When set, this user can update his profile details (except for the password. Only an administrator can update the password).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering User resources.

disableUiAccess.description: When set, this user can only access Artifactory through the REST API. This option cannot be set if the user has Admin privileges.

groups.description: List of groups this user is a part of

internalPasswordDisabled.description: When set, disables the fallback of using an internal password when external authentication (such as LDAP) is enabled.

profileUpdatable.description: When set, this user can update his profile details (except for the password. Only an administrator can update the password).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering VirtualRepository resources.

artifactory:index/xrayPolicy:XrayPolicy.description:
## # Xray Policy Resource

Provides an Xray policy resource. This can be used to create and manage Xray v1 policies.


## Import

A policy can be imported by using the name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/xrayPolicy:XrayPolicy example policy-name
```

created.description: Timestamp of when the policy was first created

description.description: (Optional) More verbose description of the policy

modified.description: Timestamp of when the policy was last modified

rules.description: (Required) Nested block describing the policy rules. Described below.

description.description: (Optional) More verbose description of the policy

rules.description: (Required) Nested block describing the policy rules. Described below.

artifactory:index/xrayWatch:XrayWatch.description:
## # Xray Watch Resource

Provides a Xray watch resource.


## Import

Watches can be imported using their name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import artifactory:index/xrayWatch:XrayWatch example watch-name
```
